entry.title: feat(cognito): import an existing user pool client (#7091)
entry.content:
feat(cognito): import an existing user pool client (#7091)

Include other clean up around awslint exclusions and CloudFormation
resource attributes.

BREAKING CHANGE: `UserPoolClient` construct no longer has the property
`userPoolClientClientSecret`. The functionality to retrieve the client
secret never existed in CloudFormation, so this property was not
working in the first place.
* **cognito:** The `userPoolClientName` property on the `UserPoolClient`
construct will throw an error if client name was not configured on the
`UserPoolClient` during initialization. This property was previously
incorrectly configured and was returning a not-implemented message from
CloudFormation every time.

entry.title: docs(iam): improve consistency for static import methods (#7048)
entry.content:
docs(iam): improve consistency for static import methods (#7048)

Updates inline documentation for static `from...Arn` and `from...Name` import methods to provide consistent verbiage, parameter specification, and known caveats.

entry.title: chore(cli): fix bootstrap v2 by adding a missing 'await' (#7087)
entry.content:
chore(cli): fix bootstrap v2 by adding a missing 'await' (#7087)

The title says it all.

Q: Why wasn't this caught in testing/why didn't you add a test?

A: We had tests on this originally, but we reverted them because
they made assumptions on the source environment and would fail
when run in the pipeline. Restoring those is next on the agenda.

https://github.com/aws/aws-cdk/commit/2e9f241833ea20112c134eaa904425a26007e9d6

entry.title: feat(kinesis): stream encryption with the Kinesis master key (#7057)
entry.content:
feat(kinesis): stream encryption with the Kinesis master key (#7057)

feat(kinesis): stream encryption with the Kinesis master key

Adds a `StreamEncryption` option to specify that encryption should be enabled on a Stream with the master key managed by Kinesis.

Closes #751

entry.title: feat(cfnspec): cloudformation spec v11.6.0 (#6995)
entry.content:
feat(cfnspec): cloudformation spec v11.6.0 (#6995)

* feat: cloudformation spec v11.6.0

* add a patch for ResourceGroups Tags as the spec has ItemType specified instead of PrimitiveType

* add missing awscdk.io to package.json for newly added resources

* patch to resource groups to specify tags as Json type

* add linter exclusions for added AppMesh attributes in the spec update

Co-authored-by: AWS CDK Team <aws-cdk@amazon.com>
Co-authored-by: Shiv Lakshminarayan <shivlaks@amazon.com>
Co-authored-by: mergify[bot] <37929162+mergify[bot]@users.noreply.github.com>

entry.title: feat(amplify): source code providers (#6921)
entry.content:
feat(amplify): source code providers (#6921)

feat(amplify): source code providers

Add source code providers classes for GitHub and CodeCommit that implement
a new `ISourceCodeProvider` interface.

Fixes #6818

BREAKING CHANGE: use the `sourceCodeProvider` prop to connect your app to a source
code provider. The props `repository`, `accessToken` and `oauthToken` do not exist
anymore in `AppProps`.

entry.content:
docs(kinesis): refresh README and add updated snippets (#7038)

docs(kinesis): refresh README and add updated snippets

entry.title: chore: add key to disable announcing releases in awscdkio when creatiâ€¦
entry.content:
chore: add key to disable announcing releases in awscdkio when creating missing libraries (#7064)

chore: add key to disable announcing releases in awscdkio when creating missing libraries

Following on from #6800 where we added a pkglint rule verifying that the awscdkio.announce
key is set to false in `package.json`

This change is to ensure that libraries created from Cfn spec updates in the future are compliant.

entry.title: fix(aws-kinesis): test assume order between stacks (#7065)
entry.content:
fix(aws-kinesis): test assume order between stacks (#7065)

Since StackA and StackB do not have a parent child relation, we can't assume StackB will be prepared between StackA.
